description: Solid dosage form containing one or more active drugs, typically ingested orally.
Dosage form where the drug is enclosed within a soluble shell, usually made of gelatin.
Liquid preparation containing a high concentration of sugar, often used for oral administration of liquid medications.
Sterile liquid preparation administered via needle directly into the body (e.g., intravenous, intramuscular).
Semisolid preparation, greasy in texture, intended for external application to the skin or mucous membranes.
Semisolid emulsion of oil and water, less greasy than an ointment, used for topical application.
Solid dosage form inserted into a body cavity (e.g., rectum, vagina) where it dissolves or melts.
Liquid preparation containing fine solid particles dispersed throughout a liquid medium; requires shaking before use.
Device that delivers medication (often in powder or aerosol form) directly to the lungs via the respiratory tract.
Sterile liquid solutions intended for administration into the eye (ophthalmic) or ear (otic).
